Biography

2023-2024: Named Empire 8 Player of the Year for fourth consectuvei season... Named Empire 8 Defensive Player of the Year... Voted First-Team All-Conference... Member of Empire 8 All-Tournament Team... Appeared and started in all 27 games of the season … Averaged 29.7 minutes a game … Averaged 20.9 PPG and 9.8 REB … Hit 2000 career points against Alfred University on 2/2/24.

2022-2023: Named Empire 8 Player of the Year for third consecutive year... Voted First-Team All-Conference... Started and played in 29 games... Averaged 18.3 points per game, 9.0 rebounds per game, 3.3 assists per game and 1.5 steals per game while playing in 27.3 minutes per game... Honored by Rochester Radio Club as winner of the Rich Funke Jr. College Male Award...D3Hoops Fourth-team All-America and All-Region team... Named to NABC All-District Team.

2021-2022: Named Empire 8 Player of the Year ... Voted First-Team All-Conference ... Named to the Bevo Francis Top 100 Watch List ... D3Hoops.com Preseason All-American ... Started in 25 of the team's 26 games as a Junior ... Led the Empire 8 with 19.7 points and 10.3 rebounds along with 2.7 assists and 1.2 blocks ... Scored 25 points or more five times including a career-high 47 points setting a program record for points in a game and field goals scored in a game with 17 ... Became the 27th player in program history to score 1,000 points after scoring 22 in a 114-78 win over Elmira.

2020-2021: Named the Empire 8 Player of the Year ... Voted as First-Team All-Conference ... Named First-Team All-Region by D3hoops.com ... Led the Empire 8 with 21.5 points and 10.9 rebounds per game ... Led Fisher and was among the nation's leaders in field goal percentage at .575 overall ... Named the Empire 8 Player of the Week three times ... Started all 13 games and averaged nearly 2.5 assists and 1.5 blocks per game ... Recorded 10 double-doubles on the year ... Scored at least 25 points in a game three times including a career-high 38 points on March 23, 2021 against Houghton.

Prior to Fisher: Attended Hobart College where he averaged over nine points and five rebounds per game for the Statesmen.

High School: Played on the varsity basketball team from 2017-19 ... Named All-Greater Rochester Player of the Year and was selected to Second-Team All-State in 2019 ... Named All-County Player of the Year in 2018-19 and was named All-State in 2018 ... Helped Pittsford-Mendon claim a Section V title in 2019 and advanced to the State finals.

Personal: Dan is the son of Todd and Laura ... He is majoring in Marketing.

No stats available for the current season.
